article.headline: Panthers snap nine-game skid
article.linkText: Prairie View notches season's first victory
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. (AP) -- Phillip Scott scored 26 points to lead Prairie View A&M to a 77-69 victory over Alcorn State on Monday night. Jared Ellison came off the bench and added 16 points for the Panthers (1-9, 1-0 Southwestern Athletic Conference), which snapped a nine-game losing streak to start the season. Almaad Jackson and Delvin Thompson each scored 18 points for Alcorn State (1-10, 0-1), which has lost five straight since beating Arkansas Baptist on Dec. 4. Prairie View A&M took command of its SWAC opener with an impressive first half in which Panthers made 59 percent of their shots, held Alcorn State to 29 percent shooting and led 38-28 at halftime. Prairie View A&M shot 49 percent from the field for the game. DeAndre Jones added 10 points for the Braves, who made just 36 percent of their shots. It was a sloppy game which featured a combined 54 fouls and 45 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
